Posts.Content: klanders wrote: Has anyone else had their cancer grow while taking TC? I had bilateral breast cancer two years ago and had a BMX but no chemo/radiation. The cancer came back and I had a lumpectomy in April and then started on Taxotere and Cytoxan. I was supposed to start radiation this week but my radiation oncologist noticed something suspicious (that everyone else had missed) on my February PET scan. I had the PET scan redone and those suspicious spots are two areas of cancer that are now larger. (One in a mammary lymph node and the other behind my pec muscle.) The tumor board is meeting again on Monday to discuss whether I need surgery, more chemo (probably Adriamycin), or to just zap it with radiation. I'd appreciate hearing from others who might have experienced this same thing to hear what worked for them. This cancer must be pretty aggressive. I'm currently stage 3c and hope to not move on to stage 4. Dx 2/1/2013, IDC, 1cm, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 2/6/2013, IDC, 3cm, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 3/28/2013 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Sentinel Surgery 4/23/2013 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Dx 1/27/2015, IDC, Left, <1cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (FISH) Surgery 4/2/2015 Lumpectomy; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Chemotherapy 4/30/2015 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 8/17/2015 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Hormonal Therapy 8/26/2015 Arimidex (anastrozole), Zoladex (goserelin) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tumors grew during TC chemo - now what? klanders KBeee

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2013 09:28PM klanders wrote: Hi, I had a BMX with immediate reconstruction in April using DIEP flaps. This past week was stage 2 for me. My doc liposuctioned my thighs (covered by insurance) and did some extra fat grafting in my breasts to round them out. Right now I look like I was hit by a truck! I've never seen such bad bruising - thighs and lower back. I was already happy with how I looked after stage 1 so I'm just praying I haven't messed things up. I'm very swollen but this too shall pass!
Posts.Title: Liposuction...anyone? jennyboog jennyboog

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2015 02:40PM klanders wrote: Thanks, Aff... that's very reassuring! It feels vain to even worry about, but after all I've been through it's nice to look in the mirror and still feel like me. :-)
Posts.Title: Anyone have radiation after DIEP? klanders klanders

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2013 11:26PM klanders wrote: I live in Michigan and my local doc diagnosed my breast cancer on Feb. 1.  An MRI revealed a second tumor in my other breast.  At a friend's insistence my husband and I flew to MD Anderson on Feb. 12th and I met with Dr. Meric (surgeon) and Dr. Melham (oncologist).  Logistically, when we found out how many times we'd have to fly back and forth, we decided not to be treated at MD Anderson.  That said, if I lived as close as you do I'd be there in a heartbeat!!!  Both those doctors were fantastic and are highly qualified.  But I would think that would be the case for any of their docs.  MD Anderson is ranked #1 in the country for cancer treatment.  My time wasn't wasted because when they relooked at my slides they changed me from HER2 positive to HER2 negative.  Tomorrow I finally will get to see docs at University of  Michigan to decide on my treatment plan.  This is a scary time but you will be in good hands.  Every woman I spoke to at MD Anderson was thrilled to be there.
Posts.Title: Need the best at MD Anderson scott-m Lora1969

Posts.Content: klanders wrote: I had a BMX with immediate DIEP reconstruction in April, 2013. Now I've had a recurrence in the left breast and I'm going to be starting radiation at the end of July. I'm finding very little information about the effects of radiation on a DIEP. I think it's probably in my favor that it's two years later. Any DIEP ladies out there who had radiation after DIEP? It sounds like maybe I could have some fat necrosis develop and maybe some shrinkage? I went through a lot of pain and money to get great cosmetic results (NOLA girl) and I'm sad that I might lose that. I love that every doc who sees me can't believe that I've had a BMX because they look so natural. Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2015 06:20PM klanders wrote: Hi Diana. Thanks so much for replying! I know everyone is different but it makes me feel so much better to read that you didn't experience any change. Makes me feel like there is hope! I will be having full breast plus supraclavicular nodes and internal mammary nodes radiated-30 sessions. But first I have to get through one more chemo, which all in all has gone better than I expected. I should be done the week my kids go back to school.
